description.narrative:
Project level-outcomes: Stakeholders impact on customers/users and community
-Impact on reliability: The project will help reduce the power outages for the region, reducing the length of the power outages and reducing the average transmission and distribution loses. On 2016, power outages reached in total 96 hours in the Caribbean Coast, one of the highest in the Country and well above the 36 hours in average of the country. This Project will help to stabilize and improve the system quality and reliability in La Guajira which is the second poorest region in the country with high income inequality. The project is expected to benefit more than 155,000 costumers (approx. 1 million inhabitants in La Guajira).
-The Impact on Community: The project will create job opportunities to the local community mainly during construction phase. creating employment on the region.
Market creation
-Inclusiveness: Accessibility to a reliable power system for BoP customers in La Guajira, one of the regions with the highest income disparity and lowest access to electricity services in the country.

The proposed project entails the construction of a 138km, 100kv regional transmission line in La Guajira, Colombia (the Project). Following an open tender process, the Colombian Energy Planning National Authority (UPME) awarded this Project to Elecnorte S.A.S (Elecnorte or the Company). The project comprises the design, construction, operation, and maintenance of the regional transmission line for 25 years and the refurbishment of three existing sub-stations.
